channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump threatens military force if violence in states isn't stopped
item.description: President Donald Trump will deliver a statement from the Rose Garden on Monday, the White House said, providing a venue to address growing racial unrest gripping the country.

item.title: Peaceful protesters near White House gassed, shot with rubber bullets as Trump leaves for church photo-op
'I'm outraged': Bishop overseeing church responds to Trump photo-op
item.description: Bishop Mariann Edgar Budde, who oversees St. John's Episcopal Church in Washington DC, responds to President Trump's photo-op at the church shortly after his remarks about the protests over the death of George Floyd.

item.title: Some in Pentagon increasingly wary as Trump pushes military response to domestic protests
As America sees another night of protests and curfews, families of those killed plea for no more violence
Three videos piece together the final moments of George Floyd's life
Trump is gift-wrapping a propanganda win for China
Houston police chief to Trump: If you can't be constructive, keep your mouth shut
item.description: Houston police chief Art Acevedo responds to President Trump telling governors to "dominate" protesters.

item.title: A rare wave of public dissent from Facebook employees
item.description: In a rare example of public dissent, some Facebook employees are taking to Twitter to express strong disagreements with CEO Mark Zuckerberg's decision not to take any action on a series of controversial posts last week from President Donald Trump, including an apparent threat that "looting" would lead to "shooting."

item.title: WHO: The Americas are seeing a rapid increase in Covid-19 cases
The sixth mass extinction is happening faster than expected, and it's our fault
item.description: The sixth mass extinction is not a worry for the future. It's happening now, much faster than previously expected, and it's entirely our fault, according to a study published Monday.

item.title: Boris Johnson's Brexit nightmare is back at the worst possible moment
item.description: June 2020 is set to be one of the most important months in Boris Johnson's somewhat tumultuous first year as Prime Minister.

item.title: Should you fly yet? Here's what an epidemiologist and an exposure scientist say
item.description: We don't know about you, but we're ready to travel. And that typically means flying.

item.title: Fauci hasn't spoken with Trump in two weeks
item.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci, one of the most prominent members of the White House coronavirus task force, said on Monday that he has not spoken to or met with President Donald Trump in two weeks.

item.title: Tear gas fired at peaceful protesters outside of White House
item.description: Peaceful protesters in Washington were tear gased outside of the White House just minutes before President Donald gave a speech in the Rose Garden declaring he will mobilize the US military to end "riots and lawlessness."

item.title: Moderna set off a frenzy with its vaccine trial. Some are calling for an investigation
item.description: Moderna set off a frenzy on Wall Street earlier this month when it announced positive, preliminary results from its coronavirus vaccine trial. As the hype grew, the young biotech company and its leading investor wasted no time capitalizing on the briefly surging stock price.

item.title: Social distancing and masks do reduce risk of getting Covid-19, major review finds
item.description: Stay 6 feet apart and, while you're at it, wear a face covering. While most countries around the world have instituted simple steps like these to help stop the spread of Covid-19, the scientific evidence behind them hasn't always been clear-cut and has, in the case of masks, sometimes been contradictory.

item.title: Sewage could hold the key to stopping new coronavirus outbreaks
item.description: The vast brown rivers of sludge that gush into the sewage treatment plants across Germany may hold a key to early detection of any new wave of the coronavirus, scientists tell CNN.

item.title: Protests spread to London and Berlin
item.description: Protesters took to the streets in London and Berlin to show solidarity with demonstrators in the US over the death of George Floyd while in police custody. CNN's Nic Robertson reports.

item.title: DOJ hits brakes on police investigations, experts say
item.description: During the Obama administration, high-profile police shootings of black men like Michael Brown in Ferguson, Missouri and Laquan McDonald in Chicago helped spark sweeping federal investigations and reforms of biased policing practices.

item.title: Thousands around the world protest George Floyd's death in global display of solidarity
item.description: Protesters have marched in the US for six consecutive nights over the death of George Floyd at the hands of a police officer. Their anger over the killing of the unarmed black man has now spread worldwide.

item.title: See police officers kneel in solidarity with protesters
item.description: In the midst of protests around the nation, moving scenes unfolded in New York and Coral Gables, Florida, when some of the cities' police officers knelt in solidarity with protesters.

item.title: Biden's in one of the best positions for any challenger since scientific polling began
Cadets brought back for West Point graduation at which Trump will speak test positive
item.description: About 15 cadets from the US Military Academy Class of 2020 who were brought back for graduation where President Donald Trump is scheduled to give the commencement address have tested positive for coronavirus, according to a US Army spokesperson.

item.title: Truck drives through protesters in Minnesota
item.description: A truck driver has been arrested after driving through protesters in Minnesota, according to Governor Tim Walz.

item.title: Prince with coronavirus apologizes for breaking quarantine and attending party
item.description: A Belgian prince has apologized, after testing positive for coronavirus two days after attending a social gathering in Córdoba, Spain.

item.title: SpaceX's Crew Dragon took flight in historic mission. What's next?
Sheriff takes off riot gear and joins protesters
item.description: Genesee County Sheriff Chris Swanson spoke with demonstrators who were met by police officers in riot gear and then joined the protest, according to CNN affiliate WEYI.

item.title: Mining firm sorry for blowing up 46,000-year-old sacred indigenous site
item.description: Mining giant Rio Tinto has apologized after blowing up a 46,000-year-old sacred indigenous site with dynamite to expand an Australian iron ore mine.

item.title: Shooting at US Air Force base leaves two dead
item.description: An early morning shooting at Grand Forks Air Force Base in North Dakota has left two active-duty military members dead.

item.title: Prayer book once owned by tragic queen to be sold at auction for up to $434,000
item.description: A prayer book that once belonged to Mary, Queen of Scots and contains an inscription by the tragic monarch is to go on sale, with an expected price of up to £350,000 ($432,000).

item.title: Will protests lead to another wave of coronavirus cases?
item.description: Government leaders and health officials have expressed their concern that coronavirus could rapidly spread during protests over the death of George Floyd.

item.title: World-famous beach emptied by coronavirus
item.description: Miguel Oliveira firmly pushes down on the limes and sugar in the cocktail shaker, for the first time that day. It's noon, and this, together with the sparsely-populated promenade his kiosk bar sits on, is just one sign that something is wrong in Rio de Janeiro.

item.title: First human trial of potential antibody treatment for Covid-19 begins
item.description: Eli Lilly and Company said Monday it has started the first human trial of an antibody therapy designed to treat Covid-19.

item.title: Preschoolers are using apps meant for adults, study finds
item.description: Relaxing the rules on screen time for kids has become more acceptable during the pandemic as parents struggle to balance working from home with the demands of childcare, schoolwork and cabin fever.

item.title: John Legend says his friendship with Kanye West has evolved
item.description: John Legend and Kanye West are in "different places," according to the singer.

item.title: Fox Sports anchor apologizes for 'completely inappropriate' Adolf Hitler joke
item.description: Fox Sports anchor Matty Johns has apologized for a "completely inappropriate" joke after a TV segment featuring a photoshopped cardboard cutout of Adolf Hitler was aired on one of the broadcaster's Australian National Rugby League shows.

item.title: First sighting of Queen Elizabeth, 94, during lockdown -- and she's on a horse
item.description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth II has been pictured riding on horseback in Windsor, west of London, in her first public appearance since the coronavirus lockdown began in the UK.

item.title: What nudists do during a lockdown
item.description: On an average weekday, you might find Parisian Laurent Luft enjoying a swim at the city's Roger Le Gall swim center.

item.title: Sylvester Stallone to narrate 'emotional' new 'Rocky' documentary
item.description: A new "Rocky" documentary is on its way -- and it's narrated by the Italian Stallion himself, Sylvester Stallone.

item.title: Boy, 9, with cerebral palsy completes marathon on his walker, half a mile at a time
item.description: A 9-year-old boy with cerebral palsy and autism has raised $100,000 for charity after completing a marathon up and down his street using a walker.

item.title: 'My emotions were so raw': The people creating art to remember George Floyd
item.description: In the wake of George Floyd's death at the hands of a Minneapolis police officer, artists have been quick to respond with works that seek to memorialize, to provoke and to heal.

item.title: How to talk to your children about protests and racism
item.description: As cities and social media explode with anger over the killing of yet another black man at the hands of police, worried parents struggle with how to protect their children from seeing the worst of the violence while simultaneously explaining the ravages of racism.

item.title: CNN turns 40 today. Here's what it was like on Day One
item.description: The world's first 24-hour news network came to life on June 1, 1980. Watch a behind the scenes look at what CNN looked like on its first day.

item.title: Some in Pentagon increasingly wary as Trump pushes military response to domestic protests
item.description: Defense officials tell CNN there was a deep and growing discomfort among some in the Pentagon even before President Donald Trump announced Monday that he is ready to deploy the military to enforce order inside the United States.

item.title: Agitated Trump tells governors to exact 'retribution' on protesters
item.description: President Donald Trump, agitated and distressed after three nights of violent protests in dozens of cities across the country -- including outside of his home -- told the nation's governors in a video teleconference Monday to aggressively target violent protesters he said would only respond to a show of force.

item.title: Obama responds: 'Let's not excuse violence, or rationalize it'
item.description: Former President Barack Obama on Monday condemned violence amid protests over the death of George Floyd and police brutality and called for political solutions to address protesters' grievances about criminal justice.

item.title: Trump is gift-wrapping a propanganda win for China
item.description: • For the first time in 30 years, Hong Kong will not hold a mass vigil commemorating the Tiananmen square massacre • Opinion: Trump is taking a page straight from the CCP's playbook

item.title: Independent Floyd autopsy at odds with medical examiner's report
item.description: • Three videos piece together George Floyd's final moments • As America sees another night of protests and curfews, families of those killed plea for no more violence

item.title: WHO: The Americas are seeing a rapid increase in Covid-19 cases
